title: Chapter 1: The Awakening
content:
The neon rain fell hard on the pavement, washing away the sins of the city. Or so they said.

Jack adjusted his collar, the synthetic fabric itching against his neck. He hated this part of town. The lower levels were always damp, smelling of ozone and cheap noodles.

"You got the drive?" the contact asked, his face hidden in the shadows of a flickering hologram advertisement.

"I got it," Jack replied, patting his pocket. "But the price just went up."

The contact laughed, a harsh, metallic sound. "You think you're in a position to negotiate, kid?"

Jack smirked. "I know I am. Because I know what's on this drive. And so do you."
